text: Anna Deavere Smith (born September 18, 1950) is an American actress, playwright, and professor. She is known for her roles as National Security Advisor Dr. Nancy McNally in The West Wing (2000–06), Gloria Akalitus in the Showtime series Nurse Jackie (2009–15), and Tina Krissman on the ABC show For the People (2018–19). Smith is the founding director of the Institute on the Arts and Civic Dialogue at New York University. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American playwrights Category:Writers from Baltimore Category:Actors from Baltimore Category:Actors from New York City Category:Educators from Baltimore Category:Academics from New York City
title: Anna Deavere Smith
